In other forms, methods of manufacturing poly-material emitters are disclosed comprising providing a polyethylene and an elastomeric material, molding the polyethylene into a rigid emitter body integrally defining an inlet, an outlet and a pressure reducing flow passage extending from the inlet, the rigid emitter body further defining a seat for a pressure compensating member, molding the elastomeric material into a pressure compensating member integrally defining: a flexible floor; side walls extending substantially about a perimeter of the flexible floor and including an ingress opening and an egress opening; and at least one tapering baffle that separates the flexible floor and pressure compensating member into an upstream portion and a downstream portion with both the upstream portion and downstream portion having respective volumes or cross-sectional areas and the volume or cross-sectional area of the upstream portion being larger than the volume or cross-sectional area of the downstream portion to assist the pressure compensating member in flushing grit therethrough or through the emitter. Similarly, methods of manufacturing irrigation drip line tubes with such poly-material emitters are also contemplated. In some forms, a method of manufacturing an irrigation drip line tube includes providing a polyethylene and an elastomeric material, molding the polyethylene into a plurality of rigid emitter bodies each integrally defining an inlet, an outlet, a pressure reducing flow passage extending from the inlet, and a seat or socket, molding the elastomeric material into a plurality of pressure compensating members seated in the seat or socket of the rigid emitter bodies, with each pressure compensating member integrally defining: a flexible floor; side walls extending substantially about a perimeter of the flexible floor and including an ingress opening and an egress opening; and at least one tapering baffle that separates the flexible floor and pressure compensating member into an upstream portion and a downstream portion with both the upstream portion and downstream portion having respective volumes or cross-sectional areas and the volume or cross-sectional area of the upstream portion being larger than the volume or cross-sectional area of the downstream portion to assist the pressure compensating member in flushing grit therethrough, and further extruding a drip line tube having an inner surface and an outer surface with the inner surface defining an inner circumference of the tube, and connecting the plurality of discrete elastomeric emitter bodies to only a portion of the inner circumference of the inner surface of the tube and at regular intervals therein.

Thus, it is apparent that there has been provided, in accordance with the invention, an elastomeric emitter and methods relating to same that fully satisfies the objects, aims, and advantages set forth above. While the invention has been described in conjunction with specific embodiments thereof, it is evident that many alternatives, modifications, and variations will be apparent to those skilled in the art in light of the foregoing description. Accordingly, it is intended to embrace all such alternatives, modifications, and variations as fall within the spirit and broad scope of the appended claims.

claim.claim-text: 1.-19. (canceled)

20. An irrigation drip emitter outlet comprising: an emitter outlet body defining: a bottom wall and at least three side walls defining a bath within which fluid collects, the bottom wall having an inner surface in the bath and an opposite facing exterior surface; a rib projecting from the inner surface into the bath; and a projection extending from the exterior surface of the bottom wall, the outlet body having a first thickness at only the bottom wall, a second thickness at the bottom wall and the projection, and a third thickness at the bottom wall, the projection, and the rib.
21. The irrigation drip emitter outlet of claim 20, wherein the rib extends from at least one of the side walls into the bath.
22. The irrigation drip emitter outlet of claim 21, wherein the rib extends along a central axis of the bath.
23. The irrigation drip emitter outlet of claim 20, wherein the rib and the projection each have an extension that encompasses a center of the bottom wall.
24. The irrigation drip emitter outlet of claim 20, wherein the projection aligns with at least a majority of the bottom wall.
25. The irrigation drip emitter outlet of claim 20, wherein at least a portion of the rib projects from the interior surface less than the side walls.
26. The irrigation drip emitter outlet of claim 20 wherein the second thickness is greater than the first thickness and the third thickness is greater than the second thickness.

27. The irrigation drip emitter outlet of claim 20 comprising an ingress channel adjacent the bath defining a plurality of turns for reducing a velocity of the fluid traveling through the emitter outlet body.
28. The irrigation drip emitter outlet of claim 27, further comprising at least one constriction between the ingress channel and the bath.

29. The irrigation drip emitter outlet of claim 27, wherein the ingress channel has a first segment that is substantially perpendicular to a second segment located downstream of the first segment which causes fluid flowing through the ingress channel to make a first fluid velocity reducing turn.

30. The irrigation drip emitter outlet of claim 29, wherein the ingress channel includes a first opening located off of the second segment that causes at least a portion of the fluid flowing through the ingress channel to make a second fluid velocity reducing turn.
31. The irrigation drip emitter outlet of claim 20 wherein the outlet is made entirely of elastomeric material.

32. An irrigation drip emitter comprising: an inlet portion; a pressure reducing portion; and a drip emitter outlet according to claim 20, wherein the inlet portion, the pressure reducing portion and the drip emitter outlet are in fluid communication with one another.

33. The irrigation drip emitter of claim 32 comprising a pressure compensating portion in fluid communication with the inlet portion, the pressure reducing portion, and the drip emitter outlet and positioned downstream of the pressure reducing portion and upstream of the drip emitter outlet.

34. The irrigation drip emitter of claim 33 comprising a single piece discrete emitter body defining the inlet portion, the pressure reducing portion, the pressure compensating portion, and the drip emitter outlet and the single piece discrete emitter body is made entirely of elastomeric material.

36. The irrigation drip emitter of claim 35 comprising a rib that projects into the bath from the inner surface of the bottom wall, the emitter body having a third thickness at the bottom wall, the projection, and the rib, and the third thickness being greater than the first thickness and the second thickness.
37. The irrigation drip emitter of claim 35 wherein the emitter body comprises a pressure compensating portion in fluid communication with the pressure reducing portion.

38. The irrigation drip emitter of claim 37 wherein the pressure compensating portion comprises a movable floor that moves between at least a first position and a second position depending on fluid pressure in the drip line, and the movable floor having a floor thickness that is less than the second thickness of the outlet portion.
39. The irrigation drip emitter of claim 37 wherein the emitter body is a single piece and is made entirely of elastomeric material.
